title: Anvil's `eth_signTypedData_4` yields wrong signature for bytes4 values
body:
### Component

Anvil

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [x] Foundry
- [x] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

`anvil 0.2.0 (577dae3 2023-09-02T00:23:39.453094000Z)`

### What command(s) is the bug in?

_No response_

### Operating System

None

### Describe the bug

Running the following curl request to sign typed data over JSON-RPC: 

```
> curl http://localhost:8545 \
-X POST \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
--data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"eth_signTypedData_v4","params":["0xf39Fd6e51aad88F6F4ce6aB8827279cffFb92266", {"domain":{"name":"Domain","version":"1","chainId":1,"verifyingContract":"0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000"},"primaryType":"Type","types":{"EIP712Domain":[{"name":"name","type":"string"},{"name":"version","type":"string"},{"name":"chainId","type":"uint256"},{"name":"verifyingContract","type":"address"}],"Type":[{"name":"arg","type":"bytes4"}]},"message":{"arg":"0x00000001"}}],"id":0}'

{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":0,"result":"0x3c7489e1c7f6ff77783da15e73e4f1d6c86a85cfb93c96cd694a0bbdbbe8528b1f4751742d61f20cc74aea534d13b2d061e7f8614afbbad2fd39c4aa7ab175521c"}
```

yields the signature `0x3c7489e1c7f6ff77783da15e73e4f1d6c86a85cfb93c96cd694a0bbdbbe8528b1f4751742d61f20cc74aea534d13b2d061e7f8614afbbad2fd39c4aa7ab175521c`.

However, I expect this signature to be `0x9ba8c4d5397168b1c50d7e796243c3d525694929561432ce1ad7ccb9cdfee2570b44869863f0118feb040c4fed933a013e499501c96599693371a8e6241b3e681c`.

This issue originates from https://github.com/wagmi-dev/viem/issues/1180.

Helpful notes:
- Signing the typed data hash locally in viem (via [`@noble/curves`](https://github.com/paulmillr/noble-curves)) yields the correct signature,
- Signing the typed data over JSON-RPC with a forked Hardhat instance yields the correct signature.
- Changing the message bytes4 argument to zero bytes (`0x00000000`) instead of `0x00000001` (or any other bytes4 value) yields a correct signature.
